intro: Besleria hirtella, commonly known as the hairy besleria, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many ornamental plants characterized by their distinctive inflorescences. The plant is notable for its velvety, hairy leaves that give it its common name and contribute to its visual appeal. It produces clusters of small, white flowers surrounded by a spadix, typical of the arum family. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in warm climates as a houseplant or in shaded garden settings.
